basics.name: Alexander TaeYang Chang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am an ambitious and dedicated student pursuing a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) and Master of Science (M.S.) in Computer Engineering in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa. I previously graduated from the same institution with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Sociology in Fall 2019. As a participant in the University's BAM (Bachelor's and Master's) program, I am on an accelerated pathway to achieve both degrees. I expect to graduate with my B.S. in Spring 2025 and anticipate completing my M.S. by Fall 2026.

interests.name: IoT (Internet of Things) and Embedded Systems

highlights: Delivered exceptional bilingual service in Korean and English, resolving customer issues effectively.
Provided operational support within the tour guide department to ensure smooth daily logistics.
Exceeded sales targets for wireless devices, service plans, and bundled promotions.
Delivered personalized customer experiences through product selection and technical support.
Maintained expert knowledge of Oakley eyewear products and compatibility.
Ensured high-quality visual merchandising and an engaging shopping environment.
Met sales targets by negotiating pricing and financing while assisting customers in selecting pre-owned vehicles.
Ensured optimal inventory presentation through inspections, detailing, and organization.

volunteer.organization: University of Hawaii at Manoa K-12 College of Engineering Tour
volunteer.position: HSFL Ke Ao Aerospace Technologies Software Division
volunteer.summary: College of Engineering tours for local K-12 students, providing an in-depth overview of the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa’s engineering programs and inspiring interest in STEM education and careers.
highlights: Provided an overview of the VIP HSFL Ke Ao Aerospace Technologies Lab.
Explained the lab’s mission to develop cost-effective, small satellite systems.
Shared insights into the multidisciplinary teamwork required in aerospace projects.

awards & honors.title: IEEE Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) Pledge
awards & honors.summary: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) is the honor society of IEEE, recognizing excellence in electrical and computer engineering, and fostering leadership, service, and professional development among its members.

awards & honors.title: IEEE Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) President
awards & honors.summary: Leading the HKN chapter, promoting academic excellence, professional development, and community engagement among electrical and computer engineering students.

awards & honors.title: Dean’s List
awards & honors.summary: Achieved a GPA of 3.5+ as a full-time student enrolled in at least 12 credits.
